title: According to quantum mechanics, is the world deterministic or non-deterministic? Also, according to quantum mechanics, do human beings have free will? - Quora

response.answer_text: You overestimate the achievements of quantum mechanics to ask such questions. According to quantum mechanics, the world is probablyy non-deterministic (see for instance Wave function collapse - Wikipedia). However, your’s are not the type of questions that quantum mechanics deals with. Quantum mechanics is even more unlikely to answer the “free will” question. However, inasmuch as this question arises from our perception of relations between space and time, one might be enclined to think that the necessity for the future to result from the past in a uniquely determined manner rather lost ground with the modern views of physics (quantum mechanics - statistical physics - relativity theories).
There is nothing deterministic in reality. Determinism is only a theoretical idea. Free will is our ability to make decisions and act accordingly. Quantum mechanics has nothing to say about either.
